intro: Nauclea nipponica, commonly known as Japanese nauclea, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruits are follicles that split open to release seeds. Nauclea nipponica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas.
